 063: 
 064:         """
 065:         #"fuzzy accumulator" logic instead
 066:         #https://medium.com/@tglaiel/how-to-make-your-game-run-at-60fps-24c61210fe75
 067:         while True:
 068:             self.current_time = self.c_get_current_time()
 069:             self.delta = self.current_time - self.previous_time
 070:             self.accumulated_time += self.delta
 071:             while self.accumulated_time > (1.0 / ((1.0 / self.ms_per_update) + 1.0))/1000:
 072:                 self.timestamp = self.c_get_current_time() - self.start_time
 073:                 PyErr_CheckSignals()
 074:                 self.event.event_type_emit(EVENT_TYPE_ENTER_FRAME)
 075:                 self.event.update(self.timestamp)
 076:                 self.physics.update(self.ms_per_update/1000)
 077:                 self.graphics.update()
 078:                 self.accumulated_time -= max(0.0, (1.0 / ((1.0 / self.ms_per_update) - 1.0))/1000)
 079:             self.previous_time = self.current_time
 080:         """
 081: 
 082:         """
 083:         #naive sleep option
 084:         while True:
 085:             self.current_time = self.c_get_current_time()
 086:             self.delta = self.current_time - self.previous_time
 087:             PyErr_CheckSignals()
 088:             self.event.event_type_emit(EVENT_TYPE_ENTER_FRAME)
 089:             self.event.update(self.timestamp)
 090:             self.physics.update(self.ms_per_update/1000)
 091:             self.graphics.update()#differs from fix your timestep (avoids interpolation), will decide in more intensive demos
 092:             print(time.time())
 093:             time.sleep(max(0.0, self.ms_per_update/1000 - self.delta))
 094:             self.previous_time = self.current_time
